page.title: 19INTERVIEW-farm worker's wife
page.content: She was brought up in the country and is very happy to bring up her own 3 children in the same environment. Despite a degree of isolation,she has only recently learnt to drive,she did not feel restricted.She and the children make they own entertainment and activities and little time is spent in front of the television.The children had all settled happily into school,despite the disadvantage of not being able to attend a playgroup run in a nearby village.She did admit that a car and a freezer were in her view essential for provisioning the family. Her fears for the future hinged on the children's education.All have gone to North Cadbury Primary,which due to a falling roll has just lost a teacher She is very happy with the standard of education each has received and hopes that any question of possible closure
